p: MPV has been implicated in several hospital and institutional outbreaks leading to mortality [ 277, 278]. Kim and colleagues [ 279] report the transmission of MPV to pediatric hematology-oncology patients during a nosocomial outbreak. The incubation period was between 7 and 9 days. Standard, but not droplet, precautions were used. In laboratory studies, infectious virus persists on metal and nonporous surfaces for up to 8 h [ 183]. Due to the significant morbidity and mortality of MPV in high-risk children, isolation precautions are important.
